definition.featurexml: <xml xmlns="https://developers.google.com/blockly/xml"><block type="feature_container" deletable="false" x="40" y="40"><value name="feature"><block type="feature_huge_fungus"><field name="planted">FALSE</field><value name="stem"><block type="mcitem_allblocks"><field name="value">CUSTOM:GlowLog</field></block></value><value name="hat"><block type="mcitem_allblocks"><field name="value">CUSTOM:LightFungusBlock</field></block></value><value name="decor"><block type="mcitem_allblocks"><field name="value">CUSTOM:LightFungusBlock</field></block></value><value name="ground"><block type="mcitem_allblocks"><field name="value">CUSTOM:SwampSoil</field></block></value><value name="replaceable_blocks"><block type="block_predicate_matching_blocks"><field name="x">0</field><field name="y">0</field><field name="z">0</field><value name="blockSet"><block type="block_holderset_tag"><field name="tag">replaceable_by_trees</field></block></value></block></value></block></value><next><block type="placement_count_on_every_layer"><comment pinned="false" h="101" w="207">This placement type works best for Nether biomes. We generate the huge fungus 8 times on each vertical layer, so that we have a proper forest at any height</comment><value name="count"><block type="int_provider_constant"><field name="value">4</field></block></value><next><block type="placement_biome_filter"><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">We add a biome filter, so that the fungi don't generate outside of the current biome</comment></block></next></block></next></block></xml>
